column4: help: after a fresh installation of 8.04 I have no more taskbar visible at the top of screen, only desktop.
nope
all i did was install all the newest updates + nvidia drivers and uninstalled Evolution (cause i don't need it)
sebNaitsabes: im using a strange setup where the Ubuntu is on an IDE HDD and has the grub loader and WinXP is on a Sata HDD
does it appear if you try to move your mouse off the top of the screen?
seven_six_two: no
I've had a similar problem, but it was because I ended up with a large virtual desktop
sebNaitsabes: if it's an nvidia driver problem, how do I fix it?
seven_six_two: i don't think i set up anything like that
I didn't either. It was an upgrade that didn't do my xorg.conf properly
seven_six_two: how did your resolve that then?
I used    sudo dpkg-reconfigure xserver-xorg
seven_six_two: and how did you kown that the problem was with xserver?
because everything graphical was out of whack. can you see the icons on your desktop?
bi
no
I don't use gnome, but can you right click on your desktop to run a command?
i'll try that then. what's the shortcut for ubuntu cmd line?
no
try alt-f2 and run gnome-panel
ok
I went into root shell interface, typed in the command, went through a bunch of menus (mostly about keyboard layout?), rebooted, same thing
